title.narrative: Project ARC ZOA CONGO

description.narrative: This is a project by ZOA DR Congo implemented under the ARC consortium programme named Inawezekana 'It is possible'

transaction.ref: 3rd installment from ZOA NL for VNGI

description.narrative: 3rd installment from ZOA NL for VNGI
Contract VNGI
Expenditures VNGI 2016-2019

title.narrative: 13. An advocacy strategy has been developed

description.narrative: An advocacy strategy, which identifies points for strengthening local governance, develops avenues for influencing on the national, provincial and local levels and identifies lobbying partners (NL MFA, MONUSCO, SSU / STAREC, etc.), has been developed, regularly updated, monitored and evaluated by the relevant local actors.

title.narrative: Number of lobby activities per specific topic towards provincial authorities

description.narrative: Number of lobby activities per specific topic towards provincial authorities

title.narrative: 1. Increased confidence in finding solutions for conflicts

description.narrative: Community groups have gained confidence in themselves and in others to find together solutions for destabilizing conflicts.

title.narrative: Number of Sociotherapy groups trained

description.narrative: Number of Sociotherapy groups trained

title.narrative: 10. Staff has adequate skills to respond to legal obligations

description.narrative: Key technical and political staff of the administrations, members of the local security committees and members of local development committees (with the involvement of the Provincial level) have acquired adequate skills allowing them to respond to their legal obligations to satisfy the needs of the population in a participatory, inclusive, transparent and accountable way.

title.narrative: Number of participants in seminars of capacity building by category (administration agents, security comitiy agents and development agents) and by sex

description.narrative: Number of participants in seminars of capacity building by category (administration agents, security comitiy agents and development agents) and by sex

title.narrative: 12. Local development plans have been developed

description.narrative: Local development plans, based on enhanced understanding of needs and priorities, have been developed in consultation with civil society (youth and women in particular), regularly updated, monitored and evaluated by the Chefferie in a participatory, inclusive, transparent and accountable way to make the access to basic services more equitable.

title.narrative: Number of updated development plans

description.narrative: Number of updated development plans

title.narrative: 11. Local security action plans have been developed

description.narrative: Local security action plans, based on enhanced understanding of needs and priorities, have been developed in consultation with civil society (youth and women in particular), regularly updated, monitored and evaluated by the Local Security Committees at Territory and Chefferie level in a participatory, inclusive, transparent and accountable way.

title.narrative: Number of signatories of MoUs of Security Committees

description.narrative: Number of signatories of MoUs of Security Committees

title.narrative: 17. Small scale farms owned by women producers have improved

description.narrative: Small scale farms owned by women producers have been improved in terms in terms of production, productivity and revenue.

title.narrative: Number of farmers receiving agricultural inputs

description.narrative: Number of farmers receiving agricultural inputs

title.narrative: 3. Communities can resolve root causes of conflict peacefully

description.narrative: The capacity of 100 community representatives to resolve the root causes of conflicts peacefully and to discuss these in the enlarged security committee has increased.

title.narrative: Number of cases presented in mediation meetings

description.narrative: Number of cases presented in mediation meetings

title.narrative: 5-6 The capacity of civil society to protect marginalized groups

description.narrative: The capacity of civil society to protect marginalized groups, youth and women in particular, against recruitment as well as violence including SGBV has increased.

title.narrative: Number of mobilization workshops

description.narrative: Number of mobilization workshops

title.narrative: Numbers of cases negotiated land with landowners (concessionaires)

description.narrative: Numbers of cases negotiated land with landowners (concessionaires)

title.narrative: 4. Increased coordination among civil society organizations

description.narrative: The coordination among civil society organizations, taking on the Civil Society values (participation, mobilization, democracy, inclusion, rights, transparency, accountability), has increased.

title.narrative: Number of inter-comunity dialogue platforms established

description.narrative: Number of inter-comunity dialogue platforms established

title.narrative: 16. Young farmers have more and modern knowledge

description.narrative: Young farmers (men, women), whose access to land is secured (by customary rights or via formal land legislation), have more and modern knowledge about agricultural techniques and crop production systems.

title.narrative: number of peasants trained in farmer field schools by sex and age

description.narrative: number of peasants trained in farmer field schools by sex and age
